That's a great list of destinations, but I'm curious about the safety measures they have in place for COVID-19. Can you provide me with some information on that?

Sure, I can provide you with some general information on the safety measures that some of the most popular post-pandemic travel destinations have implemented:

1. Bali, Indonesia - Bali has implemented strict health protocols, including temperature checks, required mask-wearing, and social distancing measures. Tourists must also show proof of a negative COVID-19 test result to enter the island.

2. Tulum, Mexico - Mexico has reopened its borders to international travelers, but the state of Quintana Roo (where Tulum is located) requires COVID-19 testing upon arrival, and hotels have implemented enhanced sanitation measures.

3. Lisbon, Portugal - Portugal has strict health and safety protocols in place and requires all visitors to show proof of a negative COVID-19 test or vaccination to enter the country.

4. Costa Rica - Costa Rica requires a negative COVID-19 test result to enter the country, as well as health and safety protocols, including social distancing and mask-wearing in public places.

5. Medellín, Colombia - Medellín has implemented various safety measures, including the mandatory wearing of face masks, temperature checks, and social distancing measures.

6. Barcelona, Spain - Spain requires travelers to show proof of a negative COVID-19 test or vaccination to enter the country. Barcelona has also implemented various health and safety protocols, including mask-wearing in public places.

7. Chiang Mai, Thailand - Thailand has reopened for tourism, but travelers must adhere to strict health and safety protocols, including mandatory quarantine, multiple COVID-19 testing, and mask-wearing in public places.

8. Marrakesh, Morocco - Morocco requires a negative COVID-19 test result to enter the country, as well as health and safety protocols, including social distancing and mask-wearing in public places.

9. Athens, Greece - Greece requires travelers to show proof of a negative COVID-19 test or vaccination to enter the country. Athens has implemented various health and safety protocols, including mask-wearing in public places.

10. Puerto Rico - Puerto Rico requires travelers to show proof of a negative COVID-19 test result or vaccination to enter the country. The island has also implemented various health and safety measures, including temperature checks and social distancing protocols.

Please note that these measures can change at any time, and it's best to check with the destination's local authorities and your embassy before traveling.
